questions.answer_description: Static routes specific the next hop router for packets destined to the specified network. In this case, traffic destined for any host in the 192.168.100.160/27 network will be forwarded to the router at 192.168.10.2
questions.question_text: The command ip route 192.168.100.160 255.255.255.224 192.168.10.2 was issued on a router. No routing protocols or other static routes are configured on the router. Which statement is true about this command?

choices.C: Packets that are destined for host 192.168.100.160 will be sent to 192.168.10.2.
choices.D: The command creates a static route for all IP traffic with the source address 192.168.100.160.
choices.B: The command sets a gateway of last resort for the router.
choices.A: The interface with IP address 192.168.10.2 is on this router.

questions.question_text: Which Ethernet interface command is present when you boot a new Cisco router for the first time?

discussion.content: All the interfaces in router are shutdown by default when you boot up a new router

choices.B: The VLAN 10 spanning-tree output is displayed.
choices.A: The VLAN 10 VTP configuration is displayed.
choices.D: VLAN 10 is added to the VLAN database.
choices.C: The VLAN 10 configuration is saved when the router exits VLAN configuration mode.

questions.answer_description: With the configuration above, when we type "do show vlan" we would not see VLAN 10 in the VLAN database because it has not been created yet. VLAN 10 is only created when we exits VLAN configuration mode (with "exit" command).

discussion.content:
The answer is C. The explanation is corret, the vlan is only created when we exit the vlan configuration mode.
agree, with your explanation
Has anyone noticed Router#? It is a nonsence.

La respuesta correcta es la C
Enter configuration commands, one per line. End with CNTL/Z.
SW9500-48x-(config)#vlan 71
SW9500-48x-(config-vlan)#do sh vlan | i 71
SW9500-48x-(config-vlan)#ex
SW9500-48x-(config)#do sh vlan | i 71
71 VLAN0071 active 
71 enet 100071 1500 - - - - - 0 0 
SW9500-48x-(config)#
Long story short, from what I can see, the answer is D

SW1(config)#vlan 3
SW1(config-vlan)#name meh
SW1(config-vlan)#do show vlan

VLAN Name Status Ports
---- -------------------------------- --------- -------------------------------
1 default active Fa0/2, Fa0/3, Fa0/4, Fa0/5
 Fa0/15, Fa0/16, Fa0/17, Fa0/18
2 Backup active Fa0/6, Fa0/7, Fa0/8, Fa0/9
 Fa0/10, Fa0/11, Fa0/12, Fa0/13
 Fa0/14, Fa0/19, Fa0/20, Fa0/21
 Fa0/22, Fa0/23, Fa0/24, Gig0/1
 Gig0/2
3 meh active
The answer is C. The explanation is corret, the vlan is only created when we exit the vlan configuration mode.

questions.question_text: Which set of conditions comprises a successful ping attempt between two connected routers configured with IP addresses on the same subnet?

discussion.content: correct answer can only be E, but not sure why there are full seconds in the answer?

choices.D: The destination host receives an echo request from the source host and the source host receives an echo request from the destination host within one second.
choices.A: The destination host receives an echo reply from the source host within one second and the source host receives an echo request from the destination host.
choices.B: The destination host receives an echo request from the source host within one second.
choices.E: The destination host receives an echo request from the source host and the source host receives an echo reply from the destination host within two seconds.
choices.C: The destination host receives an echo reply from the source host within one second and the source host receives an echo reply from the destination host within two seconds.

discussion.content: less the startum , more reliable its is!

questions.question_text: Which NTP concept indicates the distance between a device and the reliable time source?
